content.question: Consider a one-sample two-sided <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population proportion. Given that conditions for inference are met, which of the following is closest to the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value for a test statistic of <math alttext="z equals negative 1.86" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>1.86</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
